comment.shortText:
Layout the children of a model along a chain.
The x-position of each child will be projected onto the chain so that the proportion between children is maintained.
The projected positions of the children will become an array of points that approximate the chain.
Each child will be rotated such that it will be mitered according to the vertex angles formed by this series of points.
comment.returns: The parentModel, for cascading.

parameters.name: parentModel
parameters.comment: The model containing children to lay out.

parameters.name: onChain
parameters.comment: The chain on which to lay out.

parameters.name: baseline
parameters.comment: Numeric percentage value of vertical displacement from the chain. Default is zero.

parameters.name: reversed
parameters.comment: Flag to travel along the chain in reverse. Default is false.

parameters.name: contain
parameters.comment: Flag to contain the children layout within the length of the chain. Default is false.

comment.shortText:
Layout the children of a model along a path.
The x-position of each child will be projected onto the path so that the proportion between children is maintained.
Each child will be rotated such that it will be perpendicular to the path at the child's x-center.
comment.returns: The parentModel, for cascading.

parameters.name: parentModel
parameters.comment: The model containing children to lay out.

parameters.name: onPath
parameters.comment: The path on which to lay out.

parameters.name: baseline
parameters.comment: Numeric percentage value of vertical displacement from the path. Default is zero.

parameters.name: reversed
parameters.comment: Flag to travel along the path in reverse. Default is false.

parameters.name: contain
parameters.comment: Flag to contain the children layout within the length of the path. Default is false.

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.comment: Flag to rotate the child to perpendicular. Default is true.

comment.shortText: Create a model by connecting points designated in a string. The model will be 'closed' - i.e. the last point will connect to the first point.

var c = new makerjs.models.ConnectTheDots('-10 0 10 0 0 20'); // 3 coordinates to form a triangle
```

comment.shortText: Create a model by connecting points designated in a string. The model may be closed, or left open.

Example:
```
var c = new makerjs.models.ConnectTheDots(false, '-10 0 10 0 0 20'); // 3 coordinates to form a polyline
```

comment.shortText: Create a model by connecting points designated in a numeric array. The model will be 'closed' - i.e. the last point will connect to the first point.

```

```

comment.shortText: Create a model by connecting points designated in a numeric array. The model may be closed, or left open.
comment.text:

var c = new makerjs.models.ConnectTheDots(false, [-10, 0, 10, 0, 0, 20]); // 3 coordinates to form a polyline
```

comment.shortText: Create a model by connecting points designated in an array of points. The model may be closed, or left open.
comment.text:

```
var c = new makerjs.models.ConnectTheDots(false, [[-10, 0], [10, 0], [0, 20]]); // 3 coordinates left open
```

An IKit is a model-producing class with some sample parameters. Think of it as a packaged model with instructions on how to best use it.

Create a container to cascade a series of functions upon a model. This allows JQuery-style method chaining, e.g.:
```
makerjs.$(shape).center().rotate(45).$result
```
The output of each function call becomes the first parameter input to the next function call.
The returned value of the last function call is available via the `.$result` property.
comment.returns: A new cascade container with ICascadeModel methods.

parameters.name: modelContext
parameters.comment: The initial model to execute functions upon.

comment.shortText:
Create a container to cascade a series of functions upon a path. This allows JQuery-style method chaining, e.g.:
```
makerjs.$(path).center().rotate(90).$result
```
The output of each function call becomes the first parameter input to the next function call.
The returned value of the last function call is available via the `.$result` property.
comment.returns: A new cascade container with ICascadePath methods.

parameters.name: pathContext
parameters.comment: The initial path to execute functions upon.

comment.shortText:
Create a container to cascade a series of functions upon a point. This allows JQuery-style method chaining, e.g.:
```
makerjs.$([1,0]).scale(5).rotate(60).$result
```
The output of each function call becomes the first parameter input to the next function call.
The returned value of the last function call is available via the `.$result` property.
comment.returns: A new cascade container with ICascadePoint methods.

String-based enumeration of unit types: imperial, metric or otherwise.
A model may specify the unit system it is using, if any. When importing a model, it may have different units.
Unit conversion function is makerjs.units.conversionScale().
Important: If you add to this, you must also add a corresponding conversion ratio in the unit.ts file!
